intro: Polygala bifoliata, commonly known as the two-leaved milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, delicate flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are alternate, often with two lobes, and the flowers are usually white or pale blue. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for small insects.
